article.Heading: Investors to stay cautious in run-up to Budget: Experts
article.Summary: Sudarshan Sukhani of s2analytics.com believes that irrespective of how the market moves in near term, Nifty is likely to drop to 6800-6900 level before finding real support.
article.Body:
Market experts believe it is best to stay on the sidelines and indulge only in stock-specific activity at this point as there is no clarity on market direction.

"Investors are cautious as they await the Budget," says Mayuresh Joshi of Angel Broking.

"It is best to invest 10-15 percent of funds in stocks that are at reasonable valuations and have good earnings visibility for at least 2 years," Joshi adds.

He is positive on some top tier information technology companies and few cement companies as demand and realisations in the sector are expected to improve. 

Sudarshan Sukhani of s2analytics.com expects the Nifty to eventually dip to 6800-6900 level before it finds any real long-term strength.

He is still not too optimistic on public sector banking sector and says he would rather use them to take short positions.
